abstract.para: This document describes usage of the application &apptitle; version &version;

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: &apptitle; is a application and a API which can be used to retrieve TV show and movie meta data from Internet sources. This information is then stored locally and can be used to rename media files with the correct title.

listitem.para: Provides a CLI tool that renames media files with the correct names.
Fetches TV Show meta data from the Internet.
Runs on any platform that supports Java 1.6.
Provides a API for accessing the information.
Provides a store that writes Sapphire XML files.

chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: Their are a few different ways to install &apptitle;. The different distributions can be found at Downloads
All of the distributions will require a Java 1.6 compatible JRE.

sect1.title: 1. Linux Binary Distribution Packages
sect1.para:
Their are several linux distribution packages that can be found in the downloads section of the website. If your distribution uses RPM packages, then following these instructions.
Pick the packages for your distribution
Download them to a directory
Change to that directory from the console
Log in as root and run the command rpm -Uvh *.rpm
This will install the the application and a script too launch it. The script is located at /usr/bin/media-renamer.

sect1.title: 2. Any platform static Jar Disturbution
sect1.para: Their is a static jar distribution avaliable on the downloads page. This will run on any platform with the correct JRE. Simply download too your system, and type the command java -jar
